description:
It’s an ordinary summer vacation...except for the fact that Nagara’s high school has mysteriously drifted into another dimension. As the students begin to develop strange new powers, will they work together to survive the alien environment and find a way home, or will their newly formed factions and rivalries turn on each other?

(Source: Funimation)

Note: The first episode received an advance release on YouTube on June 19, 2021. The regular TV broadcast started on July 16, 2021.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Denpa
tags.description: Works that feature themes of social dissociation, delusions, and other issues like suicide, bullying, self-isolation, paranoia, and technological necessity in daily lives. Classic iconography: telephone poles, rooftops, and trains.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Achronological Order
tags.description: Chapters or episodes do not occur in chronological order.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Cosmic Horror
tags.description: A type of horror that emphasizes human insignificance in the grand scope of cosmic reality; fearing the unknown and being powerless to fight it.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Mixed Media
tags.description: Features a combination of different media and animation techniques. Often seen with puppetry, textiles, live action footage, stop motion, and more. This does not include works with normal usage of CGI in their production.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Baseball
tags.description: Centers around the sport of baseball.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Desert
tags.description: Prominently features a desert environment.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Wilderness
tags.description: Predominantly features a location with little to no human activity, such as a deserted island, a jungle, or a snowy mountain range.

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/89380077) | [Instagram 1](https://www.instagram.com/egutihisasi/) | [Instagram 2](https://www.instagram.com/eguchiworks/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/HisashiEguchi)

One of Japan's most prominent illustrators of female characters.

Eguchi began drawing at an early age, fascinated by the then-starting Japanese TV broadcasting. He got to know manga through [Osamu Tezuka](https://anilist.co/staff/96938/)'s [Astro Boy](https://anilist.co/anime/2747/). Other superheroes like Ultraman and Ultra Seven also gripped him. He has cited American pop artists such as Roy Lichtenstein and Andy Warhol as major influences.

In a 2017 [interview](https://youtu.be/2a6Wqq4zifw), Eguchi said that the ideal woman for him in his drawings isn't one that he would dream to date, but instead one he would've wanted to become if he was born a girl.

He has also provided original character designs for [Roujin Z](https://anilist.co/anime/2000/), [Perfect Blue](https://anilist.co/anime/437/), [Mujin Wakusei Survive](https://anilist.co/anime/709/) and [Sonny Boy](https://anilist.co/anime/132126/).

In 1990, he married the idol singer Mari Mizutani.

Originating from [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/). Went through [Gonzo](https://anilist.co/studio/3/) and [Shin-Ei](https://anilist.co/studio/247/) before going freelance. He is most known for his work on the first season of [One Punch Man](https://anilist.co/anime/21087/OnePunch-Man/). He is also the original creator of original anime [Sonny Boy](https://anilist.co/anime/132126/Sonny-Boy/).

Originating from [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/). Went through [Gonzo](https://anilist.co/studio/3/) and [Shin-Ei](https://anilist.co/studio/247/) before going freelance. He is most known for his work on the first season of [One Punch Man](https://anilist.co/anime/21087/OnePunch-Man/). He is also the original creator of original anime [Sonny Boy](https://anilist.co/anime/132126/Sonny-Boy/).

Originating from [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/). Went through [Gonzo](https://anilist.co/studio/3/) and [Shin-Ei](https://anilist.co/studio/247/) before going freelance. He is most known for his work on the first season of [One Punch Man](https://anilist.co/anime/21087/OnePunch-Man/). He is also the original creator of original anime [Sonny Boy](https://anilist.co/anime/132126/Sonny-Boy/).
She is currently working at MADBOX.
Shouji Hata is an Audio Engineer.
Kimura Kashiko is an editor working for Mad Box.

Most known for directing critically and commercially successful series, [Cowboy Bebop](https://anilist.co/anime/1/) and [Samurai Champloo](https://anilist.co/anime/205/).

He is noted for blending together multiple genres in his anime. For example, in Cowboy Bebop, classic cowboy western mixes with '60s/'70s New York City film noir, jazz/blues music, Hong Kong action movies, and to top it off the series is set in space. In his later work, Samurai Champloo, he unites the cultures of Okinawa, hip hop, modern-day Japan, and chanbara.

Originating from [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/). Went through [Gonzo](https://anilist.co/studio/3/) and [Shin-Ei](https://anilist.co/studio/247/) before going freelance. He is most known for his work on the first season of [One Punch Man](https://anilist.co/anime/21087/OnePunch-Man/). He is also the original creator of original anime [Sonny Boy](https://anilist.co/anime/132126/Sonny-Boy/).

__Birthplace:__ Montreal, Quebec, Canada

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/佐藤利幸) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1005180275939164161)

_Note: Not to be confused with either the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/205646/), or the [producer](https://anilist.co/staff/153933/) by the same name._

Affiliated with [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) since 2002.

Debuted as a character designer on [Boogiepop and Others](https://anilist.co/anime/101283/).

[Twitter](https://x.com/sawa_zawazawa)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/reiko_0157) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=reiko_nagasawa)

Reiko Nagasawa is an animator and character designer, raised and currently affiliated with Madhouse. She started her career in 2014 as an in-betweener for the studio. In 2021, she debuted as a character designer for [takt op.Destiny](https://anilist.co/anime/131565/takt-opDestiny/).

Married to fellow animator [Tooru Iwasawa](https://anilist.co/staff/131949/Tooru-Iwasawa).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1321375616)

Originating from Studio Dove. 

Formerly affiliated with Studio Gao, joined alongside former Dove employees [Ryoutarou Akao](https://anilist.co/staff/133754/Ryoutarou-Akao) and [Kazuhiro Ono](https://anilist.co/staff/156935/Kazuhiro-Ono).

Mentored by [Akira Takahashi](https://anilist.co/staff/112045/Akira-Takahashi) at Dove, stayed in touch after leaving the studio.

Changed his name from 石川哲也 to 石川てつや around 2007 to better differentiate between his and the older animator's credits.

_Note: Not to be confused with an older animator with the same name [Tetsuya Ishikawa](https://anilist.co/staff/360580)._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/94072097)

Close friends with [Kai Shibata](https://anilist.co/staff/132094/).

Married to fellow Animator [Reiko Nagasawa](https://anilist.co/staff/140343).
